title: Can Ninja Tabis get a nerf?
body: I hate complaining I don't want to complain but Tabis are too strong for just boots 1100 gold item its too good of an item to rush like if you're in any AD matchup getting Tabis early just makes them useless you're too tanky for them to kill you and if they use basic attacks at all which most ad champs do you're just taking 10% less of that damage and since they are just boots it doesn't set them back really I don't know what needs to be done to make it better I'm no expert and I wont act like I am but I do feel Tabis are too strong.

replies.body:
Back when I was doing some work on tank items going into last year's mid season, I was pretty convinced that an effect as strong as Ninja Tabi's really shouldn't exist until like a high tier completed item. What kept me from changing it was honestly 1) there's a decent argument that it being in the boots slot means it comes at a significant opportunity cost (this assumes the other boots have equally powerful/desirable effects) and 2) it was difficult to know what effect _would_ be appropriate here.

I'm still pretty convinced we could do better here, but unfortunately, I'm not sure what the solution is.

If you're going to nerf Tabi you need to take a hatchet to ADC power levels first. In the current game Tabi are a crutch that allow tanks and fighters to be semicompetitive with ADCs absurd damage output.
Yeah. Totally agree there are significant considerations to be made.
What a polite way to say that defensive effects can't be nerfed because of the powercrept damage in the game.

Would you say the problem with ADCs is the power of crit items? 

I think lethality and on-hit marksmen are fine. They focus on either squishy killing or tank/bruiser killing only, while suffering in the other aspect. This seems like a appropriate balance where you have a good reason to go a specific marksmen and build a specific way.  

But crit is just too ubiquitously strong against all kinds of targets. It also has two unhealthy play patterns --- 1) RNG at low crit chance 2) EXTREME scaling, which, while is appropriate against tanky targets, kill squishes way too fast in the late game.

Can you guys retain marksmen' ability to kill tanks, juggernauts and bruisers while tuning down their ability to assassinate sqiushies? A good way to do this I think is nerfing or even removing crit but buffing BONUS armor pen, MAX health % damage and BONUS health% damage on new items.  

This would make the play pattern of ADCs more healthy while keeping their intended role. And from that point you'll pick ADC bot lane if they have tanky targets. And if they have squishy targets you can go a mage or something else.

Repetoir, I think your points here are valid, but I will say with a straight face that {{item:3111}} is **not** equally powerful or desirable to {{item:3047}} . Between all the displacement effects in the game ({{champion:141}}  is a popular one now, and {{champion:5}} is growing in popularity again...) and the fact that Legend: Tenacity gives you 20% slotless Tenacity, I really don't think that there's a reason for divers or tanks to really care about {{item:3111}} . 

Skirmishers almost universally do not give a shit about crowd control in the first place, so if they want a defensive boost they'll always go for {{item:3047}} . Juggernauts may be the only ones who would value stacking Tenacity up to 60% or so, but even then they may just prefer the armor offered in the laning phase because juggernauts only ever go top lane. 

Ninja Tabi's effect would be much better as part of {{item:3143}} , making it THE anti-auto attacker item (selfish, as opposed to {{item:3110}} , though there's an argument for whether we should keep that aura in the game at all).

As for what effects would be appropriate on an armor boot item, it should be an anti-assassin item. Tanks and divers are unable to rush pure armor items to deal with AD assassins like they could in the old days (you **have** to get {{item:1401}} on tanks), meanwhile assassins are rushing lethality. If assassins want to rush lethality and roam for their kills, great. Let them get their kills on enchanters, marksmen or mages. Not divers or vanguards. 

Suggested specifics: 
Unique Passive - Wood Style - Enemies who dash or blink within 300 units of you deal 5% less physical damage with their abilities for 2 seconds. 

Unique Passive - Armor Plating - Moving builds up charges, and at 100 charges, you gain a shield that absorbs 20xlevel physical damage. 

Unique Passive - Vanguard's Reinforcement - When you immobilize an enemy champion, reduce their physical damage output to you by 20% for 4 seconds (with an Exhaust animation). This effect does not stack with Challenging Smite. Cooldown 60 seconds.

I believe there needs to be a melee/ranged split on the passive, because currently they are far too efficient against fighters while perfectly fine against ADCs.
